arm_group.arm_group_label: Oral Cancer Patients underwent Free Flap Reconstruction

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to investigate post-surgery sensory impairment and life quality
      changes in oral cancer patients who underwent free flap (Free Flap) on post-operative 6
      months, 12 months, and 24 months, respectively

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis Of Sensory Recovery Of Donor Size And Quality Life In Oral Cancer Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-III

          2. Older than 20 patients

          3. Diagnosis of oral canaer ,requiring free flap reconstruction

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Diagnosis of a serious mental illness involving formal thought disorder (e.g.,
             schizophrenia) documented in medical record

          2. Cognitive with dementia, delirium

study_pop.textblock: Oral Cancer Patients Receiving Free Flap Reconstruction

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Analysis Of Sensory Recovery Of Donor Size And Related Quality Life In Oral Cancer Patients Receiving Free Flap Reconstruction

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Plastic Surgery,Kaohsiung Medical University,Taiwan

primary_outcome.description: comparison the contra-lateral side and donor site; measurement of thermal hyperalgesia with thermal roller temperatures measurement of allodynia with brush and cotton swab measurment of mechanical hyperalgesia with Von Frey filaments sensory impairments with roller wheel

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: postoperative life quality using EORTC QLQ C-30 questionnaire .
secondary_outcome.time_frame: postoperative 6 months to one year, postoperative 1 to 2 years, and over postoperative 2 years

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
